scc_goals.description: Check whether Flow Logs for VPC are enabled

scc_goals.description:: Check whether OpenShift clusters are accessible only by using private endpoints
scc_goals.ignore_reason: This is a valid issue - tracking in https://github.ibm.com/GoldenEye/issues/issues/174

scc_goals.description: Check whether Cloud Object Storage has at least # users with the IAM manager role

scc_goals.description:: Check whether Cloud Object Storage has at least # service IDs with the IAM manager role

scc_goals.description: Check whether Key Protect has at least # users with the IAM manager role

scc_goals.description:: Check whether Key Protect has at least # service IDs with the IAM manager role

scc_goals.description: Check whether Cloud Internet Services (CIS) has DDoS protection enabled

scc_goals.description:: Check whether account has at least one VPN or Direct Link configured

scc_goals.description: Check whether Virtual Private Cloud (VPC) network access control lists don't allow ingress from 0.0.0.0/0 to port 22
scc_goals.ignore_reason: This is a false alert. The way the subnets are arranged in the VPC ensures proper workload isolation. And it's not a violation of any NIST, SOC or other control. On the contrary, FedRAMP makes it clear that SG or ACLs are currently not seen as a security boundary, only subnets (https://www.fedramp.gov/assets/resources/documents/FedRAMP_subnets_white_paper.pdf)

scc_goals.description:: Check whether Virtual Private Cloud (VPC) network access control lists don't allow ingress from 0.0.0.0/0 to port 3389
scc_goals.ignore_reason: This is a false alert. The way the subnets are arranged in the VPC ensures proper workload isolation. And it's not a violation of any NIST, SOC or other control. On the contrary, FedRAMP makes it clear that SG or ACLs are currently not seen as a security boundary, only subnets (https://www.fedramp.gov/assets/resources/documents/FedRAMP_subnets_white_paper.pdf)

scc_goals.description: Check whether Virtual Private Cloud (VPC) network access control lists don't allow ingress from 0.0.0.0/0 to any port
scc_goals.ignore_reason: This is a false alert. The way the subnets are arranged in the VPC ensures proper workload isolation. And it's not a violation of any NIST, SOC or other control. On the contrary, FedRAMP makes it clear that SG or ACLs are currently not seen as a security boundary, only subnets (https://www.fedramp.gov/assets/resources/documents/FedRAMP_subnets_white_paper.pdf)

scc_goals.description:: Check whether Virtual Private Cloud (VPC) network access control lists don't allow egress from 0.0.0.0/0 to any port
scc_goals.ignore_reason: This is a false alert. The way the subnets are arranged in the VPC ensures proper workload isolation. And it's not a violation of any NIST, SOC or other control. On the contrary, FedRAMP makes it clear that SG or ACLs are currently not seen as a security boundary, only subnets (https://www.fedramp.gov/assets/resources/documents/FedRAMP_subnets_white_paper.pdf)

scc_goals.description:: A module for provisioning an IBM Cloud Red Hat OpenShift cluster on VPC Gen2. The module either creates the required Cloud Object Storage instance or uses an existing instance. The module also supports optionally passing a key management configuration for secret encryption.
